alert.note: Alert for Casey; Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:27PM EDT until June 11 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEASTERN CASEY COUNTIES... At 427 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Magnum, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... South Fork, Lawhorn Hill, Kings Mountain, Mount Salem, Gilpin, Bethelridge, Walltown, Middleburg, Lanhamtown and Cantown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
